dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Find Network Features tool finds topological features and errors within a stream network. The stream network is assumed to be a single-part non-braided topological network. Currently the Find Network Features tool can find these topological features/errors:

  • Braids

  • Duplicate reaches

  • Overlapping reaches

  • Crossed reaches

  • Disconnected reaches

  • Upstream flow direction

  • Other potential errors

The Find Network Features tool relies on two inputs: a stream network polyline feature class, and the network topology table generated by the Build Network Topology Table from the stream network feature class, which should be named StreamNetwork. More detailed documentation of the Find Network Features tool is available here.

tool.name: FindNetworkFeaturesTool

param.name: InputStreamNetwork
param.dialogReference:
Stream network polyline features that have been generated by the Build Network Topology Table tool. The feature class name should have a file name with "_runXX" as a suffix, and include these attribute fields:

  • IsHeadwater

  • ReachID

  • IsBraided

param.name: StreamNetworkTable
param.dialogReference:
Stream network topology table, as either a DBF file or a geodatabase table. This table is generated by the Build Network Topology Table tool. The table should be named StreamNetwork, and include the following attribute fields:

  • ReachID

  • UpstreamID

  • TO_NODE

  • FROM_NODE

param.name: DownstreamReach
param.dialogReference: Object ID of the downstream (i.e. outflow) reach in the input stream network polyline feature class. This value is also the first record in the output network topology table StreamNetwork.

tool.summary:
